subject: Design
title: Confirmshaming: Guilt as a Button
description: A quick win: understand Confirmshaming: Guilt as a Button.

hook.text: 'No thanks, I don't want to save money.' You've seen this button. It's designed to make you feel guilty.

buildup.text: Confirmshaming uses shame-laden language on decline buttons to pressure users into accepting offers.

discovery.text: The technique exploits loss aversion â€” the fear of missing out on something valuable.

twist.text: Studies show confirmshaming increases short-term signups but massively increases long-term unsubscribes.

climax.text: Users remember being manipulated. Shame converts to resentment faster than marketers expect.

punchline.text: If your button makes users feel bad, your design is the problem.

quiz.question: What is confirmshaming?
options: Using guilt-laden decline buttons to pressure users
